title: Chicago judge calls ICE facility 'disgusting' and 'unconstitutional'
shortDescription: U.S. District Judge Robert W. Gettleman heard from witnesses staying at an ICE facility amid President Trumpâ€™s Operation Midway Blitz.

title: Abigail Spanberger defeats GOP opponent in Virginia governor's race
shortDescription: Democrat Abigail Spanberger beat Republican Winsome Earle-Sears in a race heralded as a bellwether for next year's midterm elections.

title: What's at stake in Supreme Court challenge to Trump's tariffs
shortDescription: In its biggest case of the term, the Supreme Court will decide whether Trump can impose sweeping tariffs on nearly every product imported into the U.S.

title: Who did Chuck Schumer vote for in the NYC election?
shortDescription: Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer said he looks forward to working with the next mayor of New York City, but declined to say who he voted for.

title: Voters in Virginia to select next governor
shortDescription: Voters in Virginia will cast ballots for their next governor in one of only two gubernatorial races in 2025.

title: Kentucky voters complain about closed polls when it's not Election Day
shortDescription: Kentucky Secretary of State Michael Adams took to social media Tuesday to assure concerned voters in his state they weren't missing anything.

title: White House lowers flags in honor of Dick Cheney
shortDescription: The White House lowered their flags in honor of Vice President Dick Cheney who died at age 84.

title: Donald Trump on Dick Cheney's death: What has the president said?
shortDescription: Former vice president Dick Cheney died Nov. 3, 2025. He was a critic of Donald Trump. What has the president said or tweeted about Bush's VP's passing?

title: See photos from around the country on Election Day 2025
shortDescription: Off-year races in New Jersey, Virginia, California, New York and more are seen as early barometers of how Americans feel about Trump and Democrats.

title: Dick Cheney, on Trump, said he 'can never be trusted with power'
shortDescription: Former Vice President Dick Cheney, who died Nov. 3, was critical of President Donald Trump after the Jan. 6 insurrection at the Capitol.

title: Congress ties record for longest government shutdown in history
shortDescription: The current shutdown began just after midnight on Oct. 1 after Congress failed to pass a new budget, marking the fourth shutdown during a Trump presidency.
